Absorb.description: You attempt to absorb some of a target's health. Make a melee attack. On a hit, the creature takes grass damage. Half the damage done is restored by the user.
Absorb.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d4 at level 5, 1d12 at level 10, and 4d4 at level 17.

Accelerock.description: You smash into a target at high speed. As a bonus action, you can immediately move up to 10ft and make a melee attack against a creature in range without taking an attack of opportunity, doing rock damage on a hit.
Accelerock.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d10 at level 10, and 1d12 at level 17.

Acid Armor.description: You are surrounded by a shield of thick acid for the duration. During this time, your AC increases by 2, and any creature that hits you with a melee attack must succeed on a CON save or take poison damage.
Acid Armor.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 10

Acid Spray.description: You spit a spray of acidic fluid that works to melt away a creature's defense. Make a ranged attack against a target, dealing poison damage on a hit. On a hit, the target must make a CON save against your Move DC. On a failure, the target's AC is reduced by 1 for the duration. This decrease may be stacked on a creature, up to a maximum of -3 to its AC.
Acid Spray.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Acid.description: You create a stream of hot acid in a 30 foot cone, centered on you. Creatures caught in the cone must make on a DEX save, taking poison damage on a fail, and half as much on a success.
Acid.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Acrobatics.description: You nimbly attack a target with acrobatic prowess. Make a melee attack, dealing flying damage on a hit. If you are holding an item when you activate this move, the damage is halved.
Acrobatics.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 6d6 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Acupressure.description:
You apply pressure to different stress points on your body, boosting a random ability for the duration. When activating this move, roll a d6 and gain the following boost based on the result. When activated on subsequent turns, any previous effect ends.
| d6 | Effect | |:---:|:-----------:| | 1 | +1 to attack rolls | | 2 | +2 to damage rolls | | 3 | +10 temporary HP | | d6 | Effect | |:---:|:-----------:| | 4 | +1 to saving throws | | 5 | Critical Hit range +1 | | 6 | +1 to Armor Class |

Aerial Ace.description: You dive at a creature with such speed that it is impossible for them to avoid. This move is guaranteed to hit for flying damage, unless during the invulnerable stage of Fly, Dig, Bounce, Dive, etc. moves.
Aerial Ace.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Aeroblast.description: You shoot out a powerful vortex of air that shreds through creatures. Any creature caught in a 50 foot line, 5 feet wide, must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking flying damage on a fail, and half as much on a save.
Aeroblast.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 6d6 at level 5, 8d6 at level 10, and 7d12 at level 17.

After You.description: As a bonus action, choose a creature in range that has not yet taken its turn in the current round. The target must immediately take its turn now, and return to normal initiative order in the next round.

Agility.description: You hone your abilities and feel a surge of speed course through your veins. Increase your movement speed by 20 feet for the duration. Applicable to any movement type the creature has.

Air Cutter.description: You create a gust of razor-like wind to slash a creature. Make a ranged attack against a creature, doing flying damage on a hit. This move scores a critical hit on 19 and 20.
Air Cutter.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Air Slash.description: You slash at a creature with a blade of sharp air. Make a ranged attack on a creature, dealing flying damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 15 or higher, the target flinches.
Air Slash.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Ally Switch.description: You use a strange psychic power to teleport yourself and one willing creature in range, switching places on the battlefield.

Amnesia.description: Your mind elevates to a new level of focus. Add +2 to any saving throw you make for the duration, but select one of your moves that is not Amnesia. You forget that move and cannot use it for the duration.

Anchor Shot.description: You attempt to entangle a target with your anchor chain while attacking. Choose a target within range and make a ranged attack on that creature, dealing steel damage on a hit. On a hit, the target becomes restrained and cannot flee or be switched out. The target may make a STR saving throw against your Move DC at the beginning of each of its turns to attempt to release themselves from the chain.
Anchor Shot.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Ancient Power.description: You lash out with unknown inner power. Make a melee attack roll against a creature, doing rock damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, all of your ability scores go up by 1 while you remain in battle. This move can be stacked for a maximum of +5 to all ability scores.
Ancient Power.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Aqua Jet.description: You lunge at a creature with incredible speed. Choose a target within 10 feet of you. A burst of water propels you towards that creature, avoiding all attacks of opportunity. Make a melee attack on that creature, dealing water damage on a hit.
Aqua Jet.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d10 at level 10, and 1d12 at level 17.

Aqua Ring.description: You surround yourself with a veil of healing water. At the end of each of your turns, as long as you hold concentration, regain a number of hit points equal to your proficiency bonus.

Aqua Tail.description: You lash out with your tail to strike a creature. Make a melee attack, dealing water damage on a hit.
Aqua Tail.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Arm Thrust.description: You unleash a flurry of fists on a creature. Make a melee attack roll, doing fighting damage on a hit. After successfully hitting a target, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, you may immediately hit again for an additional fighting damage. Continue this process until you fail to roll a 3 or 4 on the d4 roll, up to a maximum of four additional hits.
Arm Thrust.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Aromatherapy.description: You release a pleasant aroma that empowers your allies. All allies within a 20 foot circle, centered on you, are cured of all negative status ailments.

Aromatic Mist.description: You release an aroma that inspires your allies. When you activate this move, you and any ally within 5 feet of you may add a d4 to any saving throw they make for the duration.
Aromatic Mist.scaling: Higher Levels: The bonus dice roll for this move changes to a 1d6 at level 10

Assist.description: You call upon the help of another active creature in your party. When activating this Move, another creature may immediately take an action in place of your own, if you have not already taken an action this turn.

Assurance.description: You strike a creature where it already hurts. Make a melee attack against a creature, dealing dark damage on a hit. If the target has already taken damage in the same round, double the damage dice.
Assurance.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Astonish.description: You startle a creature with a loud shout . Make a ranged attack roll against a creature doing ghost damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 15 or more, the target flinches.
Astonish.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Attack Order.description: You summon your underlings to attack a target. Make a ranged attack on a creature, dealing bug damage on a hit. This move scores a critical hit on rolls of 19 or 20.
Attack Order.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Attract.description: As a reaction, when dealt damage by an attack, you may force the attacker to make a CHA save against your Move DC. On a fail, the creature must roll the damage again and use the lower result.

Aura Sphere.description: You focus your aura into a concentrated blast that strikes a creature in range. This move is guaranteed to hit for fighting damage, except when targeting a creature in the invulnerable stages of Fly, Dig, Bounce, etc.
Aura Sphere.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Aurora Beam.description: You send a concentrated beam of freezing ice at a single creature in range. Make a ranged attack roll, doing ice damage on a hit. On natural attack rolls of 15 or higher, the target has disadvantage on any attack it makes on its next turn.
Aurora Beam.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Aurora Veil.description: You use the environment to create a shield of ice around your body. Only able to be activated while it is hailing, this move can be used as a bonus action to halve all damage dealt to you for three rounds.

Autotomize.description: You shed away part of your body to make yourself lighter and increase your speed. For the duration, your speed increases by 10 feet. This move may be stacked to a maximum speed increase of 30 feet.

Avalanche.description: You send forth a heap of powerful snow to pummel a creature. Make a ranged attack on a target, dealing ice damage on a hit. If the target has dealt any damage to you since the end of your last turn, double the damage you deal.
Avalanche.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Baby-Doll Eyes.description: You quickly widen your eyes in an attempt to charm a creature, decreasing their will to fight. When you or an ally in range are targeted by a Move that requires an attack roll, you may use a reaction to impose disadvantage on the roll.

Baneful Bunker.description: You sense incoming danger and are able to quickly create a barrier to avoid it.  When targeted by an attack, you may automatically avoid taking damage on the first instance of this reaction. If Baneful Bunker was successful in avoiding' a melee attack, the attacker becomes poisoned.  On future instances of this move in the same combat, you must roll higher than a 15 on a d20 roll for the reaction to be successful.

Barrage.description: Make a ranged attack on a creature, rolling on a hit. You attack with a barrage of ranged strikes equal to the number shown. Each projectile deals normal damage.
Barrage.scaling: Higher Levels: Each projectile that hits deals 1d6 at level 5, 2d4 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Barrier.description: You create a transparent shield of psychic energy. While active, the barrier grants +2 to AC for you and any companions within 5 feet of you for the duration.

Baton Pass.description: As a bonus action, you may switch out, passing along all negative status effects or stat changes to the new creature. This includes existing battle effects from moves such as Substitute, Swords Dance, Ingrain, Aqua Ring, etc. Effects from moves that require concentration may also be transferred, with concentration now dependent on the new creature.

Beak Blast.description: You heat up your beak and strike out at a target. When you activate this move, you spend your action to charge up your beak. If you are hit with a melee attack before the action of your next turn, the target is burned. On your next turn, spend an action to make a melee attack on a creature, dealing flying damage on a hit.
Beak Blast.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Beat Up.description: You use strength in numbers to attack a creature. Make a melee attack on a creature, and an additional attack for any other conscious creature your trainer is currently carrying, dealing dark damage on each hit.
Beat Up.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to  at level 5,  at level 10, and  at level 17.

Belch.description: You let out a damaging belch at a creature in range. Force the creature to make a CON save against your Move DC, taking poison damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. If you are holding a berry when activating this move, you may consume it and force the target to automatically fail the saving throw.
Belch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Belly Drum.description: You sacrifice health for attack. When using this move, decrease your current HP by half your maximum, but increase your Strength score by 10 while you remain in battle. The effect ends if your current HP rises above half your maximum.

Bestow.description: As a bonus action, you may pass your held item to a willing creature in range, if the target is not currently holding an item.

Bide.description: You embrace the damage done to you, waiting for your time to strike. Use your attack action to activate this move, and keep track of all damage done to you before your next turn. On your next turn, you use your action to lash out at a target with a normal ranged attack, striking them for double the amount of typeless damage you took on a successful hit. At 10th Level, you can choose to hold Bide for a second turn for the chance to add additional damage to the attack.
Bide.scaling: Higher Levels: You may continue to stockpile damage for 2 turns at level 10 and above.

Bind.description: You attempt to grapple a target into submission. Make a melee attack roll. On a hit, the target takes normal damage and is grappled. At the beginning of each of its turns, it may attempt to escape with a STR save against your Move DC. While a creature is grappled, you may continue this move, as a bonus action, to do an automatic normal damage without having to make an attack roll.
Bind.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move change to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Bite.description: You sink your teeth into a target creature. Make a melee attack roll, doing dark damage on a successful hit. On natural attack rolls of 19 or 20, the target flinches
Bite.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Blast Burn.description: Explosive projectiles rain down upon creatures in a 10 foot radius, centered on a point within range. Any creature caught in the blast must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a fail and half as much on a success. This move saps you of energy, and may not activate it again until after the end of your next turn.
Blast Burn.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Blaze Kick.description: Flames burst from your feet as you deliver a powerful kick. Make a melee attack on a creature, doing fire damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 18 or more, the target is burned. This move scores a critical hit on 19s and 20s.
Blaze Kick.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Blizzard.description: Icy clouds form overhead and pelt the ground with hail and snow, centered on a point you choose within range. Each creature in a 30 ft radius, centered on a point within range, must make a DEX saving throw against your Move DC, taking ice damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Targets that fail the save by 5 or more become frozen.
Blizzard.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 6d6 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Block.description: If a creature within range attempts to flee or switch out, you may use your reaction to stop it dead in its tracks, keeping this from happening.

Blue Flare.description: You unleash an intense and beautiful line of blue flames in a 50 foot line, 5 feet wide. Any creature caught in the line must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, they are burned.
Blue Flare.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 5d8 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Body Slam.description: You thrust yourself towards a creature in an attempt to crush them with your physical size. Make a melee attack on a target. On a hit, the target takes normal damage, and must succeed on a STR saving throw against your Move DC or be knocked prone.
Body Slam.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Bolt Strike.description: You send down a powerful strike of lightning from the heavens, surrounding an area of the battlefield with surging electricity. Any creature caught in a 20 foot radius, centered on a point within range, must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking electric damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it becomes paralyzed.
Bolt Strike.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 5d8 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Bone Club.description: You strike a creature with a club of bone, doing ground damage on a successful hit. If the natural attack roll is 18 or more, the target flinches.
Bone Club.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Bone Rush.description: You rush forward to deliver a series of hard hits against a target. Make a melee attack roll, doing ground damage on a hit. After successfully hitting a target, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, you may immediately hit again for an additional ground damage. Continue this process until you fail to roll a 3 or 4 on the d4 roll, up to a maximum of four additional hits.
Bone Rush.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move change to 2d4 at level 5, 1d12 at level 10, and 4d4 at level 17.

Bonemerang.description: You throw a boomerang and make two ranged attacks against a target. On each successful hit, do ground damage.
Bonemerang.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 2d4 at level 10, and 3d4 at level 17.

Boomburst.description: You create a deafening, explosive sound that damages all creatures within 20 feet of you. Force any creature in range to make a CON save against your Move DC, taking normal damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.
Boomburst.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 7d6 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Bounce.description: When you activate this move, you use 10 feet of your movement to bounce upwards and disappear, remaining in an invulnerable state until your next turn. During this time, you are immune to the damage and effects of any move. If you have no remaining movement or are grappled/restrained before activating this move, the move fails. On your next turn, as an action, you reappear and attempt to slam down on top of a creature. Make a melee attack roll on a creature in range, with advantage, doing flying damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 15 or more, the target is paralyzed.
Bounce.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Brave Bird.description: You tuck in your wings and dive at a creature. Make a melee attack, dealing flying damage on a hit. On a hit, you also take a quarter of the total (rounded down) in typeless recoil damage.
Brave Bird.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Brick Break.description: You strike out with a powerful and focused punch. Make a melee attack roll on a creature, doing fighting damage on a hit. This move ignores the effects of moves that would reduce its damage (Harden, Reflect, etc.)
Brick Break.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Brine.description: You send a harsh blast of salt water at a creature. Make a ranged attack against a creature, dealing water damage on a hit. If the target has less that 50% of its max HP, double the damage dealt.
Brine.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Brutal Swing.description: You swing your arms around violently, attacking anything within a 10 foot circle, centered on yourself. All creatures in range must make a DEX saving throw against your Move DC, taking dark damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.
Brutal Swing.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Bubble Beam.description: You shoot a concentrated stream of bubbles at a single creature in range. Make a ranged attack roll, doing water damage on a hit. On natural attack rolls of 19 or 20, the target's speed is halved until the end of their next turn.
Bubble Beam.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Bubble.description: You shoot a series of quickly moving bubbles at a target. Make three ranged attacks, doing water damage on each successful hit.
Bubble.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d8 at level 5, 2d6 at level 10, and 3d6 at level 17.

Bug Bite.description: You lash out and bite a target. Make a melee attack against a creature, dealing bug damage on a hit. If the target is holding a berry when you hit, you immediately eat it and gain its effect.
Bug Bite.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Bug Buzz.description: You vibrate your wings, creating a harsh sound that damages any creature in range. All creatures within 20 feet of you must make a CON save against your Move DC, taking bug damage on a fail. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, they have disadvantage on their next attack.
Bug Buzz.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Bulk Up.description: You pump yourself up, increasing your adrenaline. For the next minute, choose to add +1 to your attack rolls OR +1 to AC. This move can be stacked to a maximum of +5 for either choice.

Bulldoze.description: You strike the ground so hard that it ripples out from you in a 30 foot circle. Any creature caught in the area must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking ground damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. Raised creatures are immune to the effects and damage of this move.
Bulldoze.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Bullet Punch.description: You strike with a punch that is quick as a bullet. Choose a target within 10 feet of you. You rush forward to slam a fist into the creature, avoiding all attacks of opportunity. Make a melee attack on that creature, dealing steel damage on a hit.
Bullet Punch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d10 at level 10, and 1d12 at level 17.

Bullet Seed.description: Your fire a series of high-speed seeds at a creature. Make a ranged attack roll, doing grass damage on a hit. After successfully hitting a target, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, you may immediately hit again for an additional grass damage. Continue this process until you fail to roll a 3 or 4 on the d4 roll, up to a maximum of four additional hits.
Bullet Seed.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d4 at level 5, 1d12 at level 10, and 4d4 at level 17.

Burn Up.description: You use up all the fire energy you have to inflict massive damage in a 30 foot circle, centered on you. Creatures within the area must make a DEX save against your Move DC. On a failure, the creature take fire damage and become burned. On a success, they take half as much damage without being burned. After using this move, the user burns itself out and loses its fire-typing for the remainder of combat. Dual-type fire Pokemon change to their single other type, and single-type Pokemon become typeless, losing STAB and all vulnerabilites, resistances, and immunities.
Burn Up.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 5d8 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Calm Mind.description: You clear your mind of all distractions. For the duration, double your STAB bonus when dealing damage of your type.

Camouflage.description: You blend in with your surroundings, taking on a new type for resistances/vulnerabilities/immunities. The type is dependent on the terrain, and up to the DMs discretion. (Ex: Forest = Grass, Beach = Water, Desert = Ground/Fire, Mountain = Rock, etc.)

Captivate.description: You attempt to charm a creature into pulling its punches. When hit by an attack from a creature of the opposite gender, you may use a reaction to force it to make a CHA save against your Move DC. On a failure, the attack does not hit.

Charge Beam.description: You send a beam of electric energy at a creature that has a chance to power you up. Make a ranged attack, dealing electric damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 10 or higher and the attack hits, double your MOVE modifier for the damage of this move and any other move you activate before the end of your next turn.
Charge Beam.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Charge.description: Electricity surges through your body, charging up for your next attack. Until your next turn, boost your AC by 2. On your next turn, double your STAB bonus when dealing damage of your type.

Charm.description: You attempt to charm a creature, sharply decreasing its attack. A target you choose in range must make a WIS save against your Move DC. On a fail, the target adds -2 to all attacks against you for the duration.
Charm.scaling: Higher Levels: The target adds -3 at level 5, -4 at level 10, and -5 at level 17.

Chatter.description: You shout a series of disorienting words at a creature, scrambling their senses. Make a ranged attack. On a hit, deal flying damage and cause the target to become confused.
Chatter.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Chip Away.description: You wait for an opening, striking with speed when the moment is right. Ignoring any boosts to the AC of a target, make a melee attack, dealing normal damage on a hit.
Chip Away.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Circle Throw.description: You swing the target around and throw it as hard as you can, away from the battlefield. Make a melee attack, dealing fighting damage on a hit. In wild battles, the target takes the damage and flees from battle if its level is lower than that of the user. In trainer battles, the target takes the damage and must be immediately switched out for another creature in the trainer's party, if any remain.
Circle Throw.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Clamp.description: You clamp down on a target, attempting to deal damage and keep them in place. Make a melee attack roll. On a hit, the target takes water damage and is grappled. At the beginning of each of its turns, it may attempt to pry itself away with a STR save against your Move DC. As long as the target is grappled on your subsequent turns, this move can be activated again as a bonus action with an automatic hit, dealing water damage.
Clamp.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Clanging Scales.description: You slam your scaled hands together to create an intense, sound-based shockwave in a 30 foot cone in front of you. Any creature caught in the blast must make a CON save against your Move DC, taking dragon damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. Creatures that fail the save by 5 or more reduce their AC by 1 for the remainder of combat.
Clanging Scales.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 6d6 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Clear Smog.description: You throw a clump of special mud that has the power to remove all stat changes from a target. Make a ranged attack, dealing poison damage on a hit. On a hit, any stat changes affecting the target since the beginning of battle are reset.
Clear Smog.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Close Combat.description: You get in close for a devastating strike, sacrificing your defenses. Make a melee attack on a creature, dealing fighting damage on a hit. After activating this move, the target has advantage on any attack it makes against you before the beginning of your next turn.
Close Combat.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Coil.description: You coil up and concentrate your power. For the duration, gain +1 to your attack rolls, damage rolls, and AC.

Comet Punch.description: You strike out with a lightning fast punch. Make a melee attack roll. The target takes normal damage on a hit. After successfully hitting a target, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, you may immediately hit again for an additional normal damage. Continue this process until you fail to roll a 3 or 4 on the d4 roll, up to a maximum of four additional hits.
Comet Punch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move change to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Confide.description: You whisper an untold secret into the mind of a creature in range. The target must make a WIS save against your Move DC, becoming confused on a failure.

Confuse Ray.description: You target a creature in range with a sinister ray of ghostly light. Make a ranged attack against a creature. On a hit, they become confused.

Confusion.description: You attempt to enter the mind of a target and cause confusion. Make a ranged attack on a creature in range. On a hit, the target takes psychic damage. If the natural attack roll is 15 or more, the target becomes confused.
Confusion.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Constrict.description: You wrap yourself around a creature, trying to squeeze the life from them. Make a melee attack roll. On a hit, the target takes normal damage and is grappled. At the beginning of each of its turns, it may attempt to escape with a STR save against your Move DC. As long as the target is grappled on your subsequent turns, this move can be activated again as a bonus action with an automatic hit, dealing normal damage.
Constrict.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move change to 2d4 at level 5, 1d12 at level 10, and 4d4 at level 17.

Conversion 2.description: If you took damage from an attack since the end of your last turn, you may use a bonus action to change your type to any type that is resistant or immune to the type of move used against you. This effect lasts until the beginning of your next turn.

Conversion.description: Until the beginning of your next turn, take on a new type for resistances/vulnerabilities/immunities equal to one of the types of a move you currently know.

Copycat.description: You mimic a target that you can see, in range. When you activate this move, choose a target in range and fully execute the most recent move used by the creature, using your own ability scores, level, and typing for saving throw DC, attack, and damage.

Core Enforcer.description: You send a focused laser that scorches a 'Z' pattern on a target. Make a ranged attack, dealing dragon damage on a hit. On a hit, force the target to make a CON save against your Move DC, losing all effects of its abilities on a failure, until it is switched out.
Core Enforcer.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Cosmic Power.description: You call upon a mystic force to come to your aid. For the duration, you have advantage on all saving throws.

Cotton Guard.description: You protect yourself by wrapping your body up in thick, soft cotton. For the duration, boost your AC by +2.

Cotton Spore.description: You unleash spores of thick cotton that covers the target. Force a target in range to make a CON save against your Move DC. On a fail, the target's speed is reduced by 10 for the duration. If this reduction in speed causes their speed to be 0, they are restrained for the duration.

Counter.description: When you are hit by a melee attack, you can use your reaction to make a melee attack against the creature, doing fighting damage on a successful hit.
Counter.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Covet.description: You strike out with quick and sticky hands. Make a melee attack roll against a creature, doing normal damage on a hit. On a successful attack, you steal the creatures held item if you are not currently holding one.
Covet.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Crabhammer.description: You slam down onto a creature with a heavy claw. Make a melee attack roll on a target, dealing water damage on a hit. This move scores a critical hit on rolls of 19 or 20.
Crabhammer.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Crafty Shield.description: You summon forth a mysterious power that blocks an incoming status condition. When you or an ally within 5 feet of you are subject to a status condition from a move, you may use your reaction to nullify the condition.

Cross Chop.description: You crush a creature with a strong sideways strike. Make a melee attack against a target, doing fighting damage on a hit. Cross Chop results in a critical hit on 19s and 20s.
Cross Chop.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Cross Poison.description: You slash at a creature with a poisonous strike. Make a melee attack, dealing poison damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the attack is treated as a critical hit and the target is poisoned.
Cross Poison.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Crunch.description: You unleash a powerful blow that has a chance to temporarily lower a target's defense. Make a melee attack against a target, doing dark damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 18 or higher, the target's AC is decreased by 1 for the remainder of combat. This decrease may be stacked, up to a maximum of -5 to AC.
Crunch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Crush Claw.description: You strike out with powerful claws. Make a melee attack roll against a creature, doing normal damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 15 or more, your next attack on the same target is rolled at advantage.
Crush Claw.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Crush Grip.description: You clasp your hands around a creature for a crushing blow. Make a melee attack against a target, dealing normal damage and grappling the target on a hit. If the target is above 50% of its maximum health, add your proficiency bonus to the damage roll.
Crush Grip.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Curse.description: This Move has a different effect based on your creature type. If you are ghost-type: You attempt to put a curse on a creature. Force a target in range to make a WIS saving throw against your Move DC. On a fail, the target is cursed. You take damage initially and the target takes ghost damage at the end of each of its turns for the duration. If you are any other type: You place a curse on yourself. For the duration, your STR and CON scores increase by 2, but your DEX score decreases by 4.
Curse.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d4 at level 5, 1d12 at level 10, and 4d4 at level 17.

Cut.description: You lash out at a target with vine or claw or blade. Make a melee roll on a target, doing on a successful hit.
Cut.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Dark Pulse.description: You target a creature with a dark aura filled with horrible thoughts. Make a ranged attack on a creature, dealing dark damage on a hit. On natural attack rolls of 17 or higher, the target flinches.
Dark Pulse.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Dark Void.description: You send the minds of your creatures into a world of darkness, damaging them before putting them to sleep. All creatures within 30 feet of you must make a WIS save against your Move DC, taking dark damage and falling asleep on a failure, or half as much without falling asleep on a success.
Dark Void.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Darkest Lariat.description: You dangerously swing both arms at a creature in range, ignoring any positive stat changes the target is affected with. Make a melee attack, dealing dark damage on a hit.
Darkest Lariat.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Dazzling Gleam.description: You emit a powerful flash that damages all creatures in range. Creatures within 20 feet of you must make a CON save against your Move DC, taking fairy damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.
Dazzling Gleam.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Defend Order.description: You summon forth your underlings to form a natural shield in front of you. For the duration, as long as you keep your concentration, gain +1 to your AC.
Defend Order.scaling: Higher Levels: The AC boost for this move changes to +2 at level 5, +3 at level 10, and +4 at level 17.

Defense Curl.description: You curl up into a tight ball, increasing your defensive stance. Until your next turn, you gain + 4 to your AC and have resistance to normal attacks.

Defog.description: You summon a swift, magical breeze in a 50 foot radius, centered on you, that sweeps away foggy weather and obstacles. When activating this move, any area of effect moves that are still active end immediately (Examples: Misty Terrain, Fog Cloud, Smog, etc.).

Destiny Bond.description: You create a dark, internal bond with a creature. Select a target in range, who must make a WIS save against your Move DC. On a fail, half of any damage dealt to the user is also dealt as typeless damage to the target creature.

Detect.description: You sense incoming danger and are able to quickly avoid it. When you are the recipient of the damage and/or effects of a move, you may automatically avoid the damage/effects on the first instance of this reaction. On future instances of this move in the same combat, you must roll higher than a 15 on a d20 roll for the reaction to be successful. This reaction may not be used to guard against the damage/effects that result from a natural 20 attack roll.

Diamond Storm.description: You stir up a massive storm of sharp diamonds in a 30 foot radius, centered on a point in range. When a creature enters the area for the first time on their turn, or begins their turn inside the area, they take rock damage. The Diamond Storm lasts for 3 rounds. When you activate this move, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, your AC is increased by 2 while the Diamond Storm is active.
Diamond Storm.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Dig.description: You burrow underground, disappearing from view before striking from underneath a target. When you activate this move, you use 10 feet of your movement to burrow underground (ignoring difficult terrain) and remain there until your next turn. During this time, you are immune to the damage and effects of any move. If you have no remaining movement or are grappled/restrained before activating this move, the move fails. On your next turn, you emerge from the ground and make a melee attack on a creature in range, with advantage, doing ground damage on a successful hit. If the target has Tremorsense, the attack is not rolled with advantage.
Dig.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Disable.description: You attempt to disable a target, hindering its moves. Choose a target in range. The target must succeed on a WIS saving throw against your Move DC. On a failed save, the last Move it activated is unable to be used while you hold your concentration. (If this would end Solar Beam, Skull Bash, etc. during the charge phase of the Move, the Move automatically fails on the target's next turn).

Disarming Voice.description: You let out a charming cry, dealing emotional damage to any creature in range that can hear you. This move automatically hits for fairy damage unless a creature is in the invulnerable stages of Fly, Dig, Bounce, etc.
Disarming Voice.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d4 at level 5, 1d12 at level 10, and 4d4 at level 17.

Discharge.description: You let loose a flare of electricity in a 20 foot circle, centered on you, striking all creatures around you. Creatures in the area must make a DEX saving throw against your Move DC. On a fail, a creature takes electric damage. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is paralyzed.
Discharge.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Dive.description: When you activate this move, you use 10 feet of your movement to disappear into a magical space beneath your feet, remaining in an invulnerable state until your next turn. During this time, you are immune to the damage and effects of any move. If you have no remaining movement or are grappled/restrained before activating this move, the move fails. On your next turn, as an action, you reappear and attempt to attack a creature from below. Make a melee attack roll on a creature in range, with advantage, doing water damage on a hit.
Dive.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Dizzy Punch.description: You strike out with a devastating punch. Make a melee attack roll on a target, doing normal damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 18 or more, the target becomes confused. At level 17, a natural attack roll of 17 or more confuses the target.
Dizzy Punch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Doom Desire.description: You promise doom upon a creature. When you activate this move, select a target and make an attack roll. On a hit, at the beginning of the third round after you activate this move, the target takes damage of no specific type. If the target is switched out, the damage is done to the trainer's current active Pokémon.
Doom Desire.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 7d6 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Double Hit.description: You lash out quickly with two strikes. Make two melee attacks, dealing normal damage \on each hit.
Double Hit.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Double Iron Bash.description: You punch twice with two devastating slams of your fist. Make two melee attack rolls, doing steel damage on each successful hit. If any natural attack roll is 16 or higher, the target flinches.
Double Iron Bash.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Double Kick.description: You strike twice with two devastating kicks. Make two melee attack rolls, doing fighting damage on each successful hit.
Double Kick.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Double Slap.description: You reach out to slap a creature with quick strikes. Make a melee attack roll, doing on a hit. After successfully hitting a target, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, you may immediately hit again for an additional normal damage. Continue this process until you fail to roll a 3 or 4 on the d4 roll, up to a maximum of four additional hits.
Double Slap.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move change to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Double Team.description: You create a duplicate image of yourself, 5 feet beside you. The image mimics you and attempt to fool your opponents into attacking it, instead. When subject to a damaging melee or ranged move with an area of effect of 5 feet wide or less, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, the image absorbs the damage and/or effects of the attack and disappears. Creatures with Truesight bypass the effect of this move. If grappled or restrained by a creature while Double Team is active, Double Team has no effect.

Double-Edge.description: You commit a massive attack against a creature. Make a melee attack against a target, doing normal damage on a hit, but taking a quarter of the total damage (rounded down) in typeless recoil.
Double-Edge.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Draco Meteor.description: You summon forth a meteor shower that rains down onto the battlefield. All creatures in a 20 foot circle, centered on a point within range, must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking dragon damage on a hit, or half as much on a save. After activating this move, your next attack is rolled at disadvantage. If that attack requires a saving throw, the target has advantage.
Draco Meteor.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 5d8 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Dragon Ascent.description: You soar upward and come crashing down towards a creature in range at tremendous speed. Make a melee attack roll, dealing flying damage on a hit. Any creature within 10 feet of the target must make a DEX save against your Move DC and take the same amount of damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. After activating this move, any attack roll that targets you until the beginning of your next turn is rolled with advantage.
Dragon Ascent.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 4d10 at level 5, 6d10 at level 10, and 8d12 at level 17.

Dragon Breath.description: You release a powerful breath of energy in a 40 foot cone. All targets caught in the blast must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking dragon damage on a fail, and half as much on a save. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is paralyzed.
Dragon Breath.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Dragon Claw.description: You strike out with a powerful claw attack. Make a melee attack on a creature, doing dragon damage on a hit.
Dragon Claw.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Dragon Dance.description: You perform a mystical dance, pumping yourself up. For the duration, double your proficiency bonus when making an attack.

Dragon Hammer.description: You slam your head down like a hammer to attack a creature in range. Make a melee attack roll against the target, dealing dragon damage on a hit. Hit or miss, any creatures within the line created by the attack (5 feet wide) must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking the same damage on a failure.
Dragon Hammer.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Dragon Pulse.description: You open your mouth and send a shockwave of draconic energy at a target in range. Make a ranged attack, dealing dragon damage on a hit.
Dragon Pulse.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Dragon Rage.description: You unleash a devastating flow of energy in a 100 foot long line, 5 feet wide. Each creature caught in the blast must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking dragon damage on a fail, and half as much on a save.
Dragon Rage.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Dragon Rush.description: You rush at a creature with overwhelming menace. Make a melee attack, dealing dragon damage on a hit. On natural attack rolls of 17 or higher, the target flinches.
Dragon Rush.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Dragon Tail.description: You whip your dragon tail at a creature in an attempt to send them away. Make a melee attack roll against a target, dealing dragon damage. In wild battles, the target takes the damage and flees from battle if its level is lower than that of the user. In trainer battles, the target takes the damage and must be immediately switched out for another creature in the trainer's party, if any remain.
Dragon Tail.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Drain Punch.description: Your strike a target with an energy-draining punch. Make a melee attack, dealing fighting damage on a hit, gaining half the damage dealt (rounded down) in HP.
Drain Punch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Draining Kiss.description: You attempt to zap the target's energy with a kiss. Make a melee attack roll on a creature, dealing fairy damage on a hit. The user is then healed for half the damage dealt.
Draining Kiss.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Dream Eater.description: You tap into a sleeping creature's dreams, sucking from its energy pool. Instantly inflict psychic damage on a sleeping target in range, regaining half as many hitpoints to yourself. This move does not wake a sleeping creature.
Dream Eater.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Drill Peck.description: You hammer down on a target with a peck attack. Make a melee attack roll on a target, doing flying damage on a successful hit. Drill Peck scores a critical hit on 19s and 20s.
Drill Peck.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Drill Run.description: You crash into a creature, spinning your body like a drill. Make a melee attack, dealing ground damage on a hit. This attack scores a critical hit on 19s and 20s.
Drill Run.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Dual Chop.description: You lash out at a creature(s) with two quick strikes. Make two melee attack rolls, dealing dragon damage with each hit.
Dual Chop.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Dynamic Punch.description: You strike out with a twirling punch that confuses a creature. Make a melee attack roll against a creature, doing fighting damage on a hit. On a hit, it also becomes confused.
Dynamic Punch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Earth Power.description: You cause the ground beneath a creature to erupt with power. Make a ranged attack, dealing ground damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 19 or 20, the next attack against the target is rolled at advantage.
Earth Power.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Earthquake.description: You create a tremor in the ground in a 20 foot radius, centered on you. Each creature in the area must succeed on a STR save against your Move DC, taking ground damage on a fail and be knocked prone. On a success, they take half as much damage and are not knocked prone. Creatures in range that are burrowed or in the invulnerable stage of Dig take double damage from this move. After the move is activated, the area becomes difficult terrain. Raised creatures are immune to the effects and damage of this move.
Earthquake.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Echoed Voice.description: You release a shout that echoes across the battlefield towards a creature. Make a ranged attack, dealing normal damage on a hit. Until the beginning of your next turn, if any other creature in range uses this move, they may double their damage dice on a hit. This multiplier can continue to stack to a maximum of 8x the damage dice, resetting if any of the attacks miss.
Echoed Voice.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Eerie Impulse.description: Your body generates a strange pulsating sound that can disrupt creature's ability to attack. When you activate this move, any creature within 30 feet of you must make a CON saving throw against your Move DC. Any creature that fails flinches for 1d4 rounds.

Egg Bomb.description: You hurl a hard egg at a creature that explodes on impact. Make a ranged attack on a creature, doing normal damage on a successful hit.
Egg Bomb.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Electric Terrain.description: You electrify the ground around you to create a static field of electricity. For 3 turns, no grounded creatures inside the area can be asleep. Grounded creatures are those that do not have a flying speed or Levitate, Magnet Rise, or similar ability. In addition, creatures may double their MOVE modifier on damage rolls from electric-type moves activated inside the area

Electrify.description: You suddenly surge with electric energy that transfers to your attacker. When hit by a melee attack, you may instantly use your reaction to force the attacker to make a CON save against your Move DC. On a failure, the attacking move's type is changed to "electric".

Electro Ball.description: You hurl an electric orb at a target in range. Make a ranged attack roll, dealing electric damage on a hit. Compare the target and user's highest speed type (walking, flying, etc.). If the user's speed is higher, roll the next tier's damage dice for this move. In the case of level 17 or higher, double the damage dice.
Electro Ball.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Electroweb.description: You unleash an electric net of web upon a creature. Make a ranged attack roll, dealing electric damage on a hit, and reducing the target's speed by 5 feet. The target can use an action on its turn remove any web from its body. A target whose speed is reduced to 0 is restrained.
Electroweb.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Embargo.description: You surround a creature in range with a dark aura. Force a creature to make a WIS save against your Move DC. On a failure, the target cannot gain the effect of any held item or trainer item given to it for the duration.

Ember.description: You hurl a ball of flame at a target within range. Make a ranged attack, doing fire damage on a successful hit. If the natural attack roll is 19 or 20, the target is burnt.
Ember.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Encore.description: After being targeted by a move, force a creature to make a WIS save against your Move DC as a reaction. On a fail, the creature must target you with the same move used on their next turn, even if you may be out of range.
Encore.scaling: Higher Levels: The number of turns the creature must use the move increases to 2 turns at level 10 and 3 turns at level 17.

Endeavor.description: When you activate this move, select a creature in range. the target must make a WIS saving throw against your Move DC. On a failure, the target's current HP is reduced to be equal to your own. The hit point reduction can be no more than 5x the target's level. This move can not be used in the first round of combat.

Endure.description: On an instance of taking damage that would otherwise cause you to faint, you may instead fall to 1HP on the first instance of this reaction. On future instances of this move in the same combat, you must roll higher than a 15 on a d20 roll for the reaction to be successful.

Energy Ball.description: You draw in power from nature in a concentrated ball that you send towards a creature. Make a ranged attack, dealing grass damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the next attack against the target is rolled at advantage.
Energy Ball.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Entrainment.description: You dance with a strange rhythm that causes a creature to mimic you. Choose a target in range and force them to make a WIS save against your Move DC. On a failure, choose one of their abilities to replace with one of your own for the duration.

Eruption.description: You spew hot magma in a 15 foot cone. Any creature caught in the blast must make a DEX saving throw against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. If you are at full health when activating this move, double your STAB bonus when dealing damage.
Eruption.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Explosion.description: You create a sphere of energy that packs a concentrated and devastating explosion. Choose a target within range and roll a d20. On a 20, the explosion goes off and all creature within 5 feet of that point faint  On any other roll, the explosion fails to go off and this move has no effect. If the target's level is 10 more than your own, this move automatically fails.

Extrasensory.description: You create an irritating, damaging sound in the mind of a creature. Make a ranged attack roll against a creature in range, doing psychic damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 19 or 20, the target flinches.
Extrasensory.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Extreme Speed.description: You rush to attack with incredible speed. As a bonus action, you can immediately move up to 10ft and make a melee attack against a creature in range without taking an attack of opportunity, doing normal damage on a hit.
Extreme Speed.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Facade.description: You strike out at a creature with revenge. Make a melee attack roll against a target, dealing normal damage on a hit. If you are poisoned, paralyzed, or burned, double the dice for the damage.
Facade.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Fairy Lock.description: You summon forth a mystical power that locks down the battlefield. Creatures within a 80 foot circle, centered on you, may not flee or be switched out on their next turn.

Fairy Wind.description: You stir up a series of vicious fairy winds that fly towards a creature in range. Make a ranged attack roll against a target, dealing fairy damage on a hit.
Fairy Wind.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Fake Out.description: This attack can only be used on the first turn that the user has entered combat. Make a melee attack on a creature, doing normal damage on a hit, causing the target to flinch.
Fake Out.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Fake Tears.description: You fake a creature out with superficial tears, lowering their defenses. When activating this move, a target must make a WIS saving throw against your Move DC. On a failure, all attack rolls against the target are given a +5 bonus until the end of your next turn.

False Swipe.description: You swipe at a creature but hold back power slightly. Make a melee attack against a creature, doing normal damage on a hit. If this attack would normally cause a creature to faint, it is reduced to 1HP instead.
False Swipe.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Feather Dance.description: You distract a creature in range with a beautiful dance. The target must make a WIS saving throw against your Move DC. On a fail, the target cannot add proficiency to its attack rolls for the duration.

Feint Attack.description: You bring a creature close and hit it with a sucker punch. Make a melee attack on a creature, at advantage, dealing dark damage on a hit.
Feint Attack.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Feint.description: You fake out a creature before you strike. Make a melee attack against a target, dealing normal damage on a hit. If a creature attempts to use a Protect or Detect reaction against the damage, it fails.
Feint.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Fell Stinger.description: You lunge at a creature with a devastating sting attack. Make a melee attack on a creature, dealing bug damage on a hit. If this attack causes the target to faint, double your ability modifier for attack rolls and damage on your next turn.
Fell Stinger.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Fiery Dance.description: You dance and flap your wings, sending flames in a 30 foot circle, centered on you. Anyone caught in the blaze must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, double the MOVE modifier when adding damage
Fiery Dance.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Final Gambit.description: You risk everything and use your own life force to damage a creature in range. When you activate this move, you faint, and force a target in range to make a CON save against your Move DC. The target takes an amount of fighting damage equal to your remaining HP on a failure, or half as much on a success

Fire Blast.description: Two pillars of raging hot flames explode out from you and leap towards up to two creature in range. The creature(s) targeted must succeed on a DEX save against your Move DC for each pillar, taking fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. Creatures that fail the save by 5 or more become burned.
Fire Blast.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Fire Fang.description: You attempt to pierce a creature with flame-cloaked fangs. Make a melee attack, dealing fire damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the target is burned and flinches.
Fire Fang.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Fire Lash.description: You strike out at a target in range with a burning lash, Make a melee attack on a creature, doing fire damage. On a successful attack, the targeted creature must make a CON save against your Move DC. On a fail, allies add +1 to any attack targeted at the creature for the duration. This modifier can be stacked if it fails multiple Fire Lash saves, up to a maximum of +5.
Fire Lash.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Fire Pledge.description: You send a plume of flame towards a creature. Make a ranged attack, dealing fire damage on a hit. After you land a hit, any ally that uses another Pledge move in the same round automatically hits.
Fire Pledge.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Fire Punch.description: You strike out with fire-infused fists. Make a melee attack roll, doing fire damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the target is burned.
Fire Punch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Fire Spin.description: You release a series of moving flames that dance around a target. Make a ranged attack roll, doing fire damage on a hit. as the flames swirl around it. As long as you maintain concentration, the target takes an additional fire damage at the end of each of its next three turns.
Fire Spin.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

First Impression.description: You make quite the entrance, quickly attacking a creature. This attack can only be used on the first turn that the user has entered combat. Make a melee attack on a creature, doing bug damage on a hit.
First Impression.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Fissure.description: You crack open the ground with devastating force. Choose a target in range and roll a d20. On a 20, the target falls into the crack and vanished into the abyss. On any other roll, or if targeting a flying creature, this move has no effect. The area in a 20 foot radius around the target becomes difficult terrain. If the target's level is 10 more than your own, this move automatically fails.

Flail.description: You flail about with a wild strike that increases in power the more injured you are. Make a melee attack roll against a creature, doing normal damage on a hit. If you are below 50% of your maximum health, double the damage. If you are at 10% or below of your maximum health, triple the damage. The multiplier for this attack occurs before the multiplier for resistances or vulnerabilities.
Flail.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Flame Burst.description: You release a fireball that explodes on contact. Choose a point in range. Any creature within 5 feet of that point must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a hit, or half as much on a success.
Flame Burst.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Flame Charge.description: You cloak yourself with flame and lash out at a creature. Make a melee attack, dealing fire damage on a hit. With each successful hit from this move, increase your movement speed by 5 until you are incapacitated, are switched out, or the combat ends. (Maximum of +30 to movement speed)
Flame Charge.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Flame Wheel.description: A wheel of flame explodes out from you in a 10 foot radius. All creature in the area must succeed on a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a fail and half as much on a save. If the user is frozen, this move can still be used, thawing out the creature during the attack
Flame Wheel.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Flamethrower.description: You shoot a concentrated gout of flame in an 40 foot cone. Any creature caught in the cone must succeed on a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a failure, or half damage on a success. Any creature that fails the save by 5 or more becomes burned.
Flamethrower.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Flare Blitz.description: You cloak yourself in fire and charge at a creature with serious damage. Make a melee attack against a creature, dealing fire damage on a hit. On a hit, you take a quarter of the damage dealt in typeless recoil damage. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the target is burned. If the user is frozen, this move can still be used, thawing out the creature during the attack
Flare Blitz.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Flash Cannon.description: You gather energy from the light around you and send a concentrated beam towards a creature in range. Make a ranged attack, dealing steel damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the next attack against the target is rolled at advantage.
Flash Cannon.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Flash.description: You emit an immense flash of light in a 20 foot radius circle, centered on you. Creatures in the area must make a CON save against your Move DC. On a fail, they are blinded until the end of their next turn. Outside of combat, this move can be used to light a dim area, much like the "Light" cantrip.

Flatter.description: You send mixed signals to an creature in range. Force a target in range to make a WIS save against your Move DC. On a fail, the target is confused, but it adds +2 to its attack rolls while confused.

Fleur Cannon.description: You unleash a beam of energy in a 80 foot line, 5 feet wide. All creatures in its path must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fairy damage on a hit, or half as much on a save. After activating this move, your next attack is rolled at disadvantage. If the next attack requires a saving throw, the target(s) has advantage.
Fleur Cannon.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 5d8 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Fling.description:
You sacrifice your held item to throw it a creature. Make a ranged attack. On a hit, the amount of dark damage dealt is equal to the price of the item in the manual, divided by 100 (rounded down), plus STAB (if applicable). After activating this move, on a hit or miss, the item disappears. In addition, certain items have additional effects on a successful hit with this move. After activating this move, on a hit or miss, the item disappears.

| Item  | Effect |
|:---:|:-----------:|
|  Flame Orb  | Burns |
|  Toxic Orb  | Badly Poisons |
|  Light Ball  | Paralyzes|

| Item    | Effect |
|:---:|:-----------:|
|  King's Rock  | Flinches |
|  Razor Fang  | Flinches |
|  Poison Barb  | Poisons |

Floral Healing.description: You extend a healing energy to recover the hit points of a creature in range. The target gains hit points. If the terrain is grassy, double your MOVE modifier.
Floral Healing.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Flower Shield.description: Large flowers sprout from any grass-type allies in range, boosting their defense. For one minute, as long as you keep your concentration, grass-type allies in a 30 foot circle, centered on you, gain +2 to their AC.

Fly.description: You fly high into the air to prepare for a dive bomb attack. When you activate this move, you use 10 feet of your movement to vanish and fly upwards, remaining in an invulnerable state until your next turn. During this time, you are immune to the damage and effects of any move. If you have no remaining movement or are grappled/restrained before activating this move, the move fails. On your next turn, you use your action to reappear and make a diving melee attack on a creature in range, with advantage, dealing flying damage on a successful hit.
Fly.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Flying Press.description: You dive at a creature with quick reaction speed, able to change the type of attack when you reach them. Make a melee attack against a target, dealing flying OR fighting damage, depending on your choice. STAB can only added to this move if its type is fighting.
Flying Press.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Focus Blast.description: You heighten your focus and unleash it upon a creature. Make a ranged attack, dealing fighting damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the next attack against the target is rolled at advantage.
Focus Blast.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Focus Energy.description: You shut your eyes and focus in on the energy inside you before striking. For the duration, increase your critical range by 2 (From 20 to 18+ , from 19+ to 17+, etc.). This move is not stackable.

Focus Punch.description: When activating this move, you spend your action focusing your next attack. If you keep concentration, as an action on your next turn, make an attack roll against a creature, doing fighting damage on a hit.
Focus Punch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Follow Me.description: You act quickly to entice an enemy to attack you. When a creature in range activates a Move that directly targets another creature, you may use your reaction to force the creature to make a CHA save against your Move DC. On a fail, the Move must target you instead. If you are out of range of the Move, the creature must use their remaining movement to move in a straight line towards you before making the attack (does not provoke attacks of opportunity). If you are still out of range, the move automatically fails.

Force Palm.description: You thrust your palm outward with such strength that a shockwave is sent towards a creature. Make a ranged or melee attack roll, depending on your target. If used as a melee attack, deal fighting damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 16 or higher, the target is paralyzed. If used as a ranged attack, the damage is halved with no chance to paralyze.
Force Palm.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Foresight.description: You grant yourself a brief but incredible sixth sense. On the next ghost-, normal-, or fighting-type move you activate, ignore any immunities of the target creature(s) granted by their Pokémon type. If the target's secondary type gives it vulnerability or resistance to the attack, it follows the secondary type for that effect.

Forest\u0027s Curse.description: You summon the energy of the forest to change the type of another creature. Force a creature in range to make a CON save against your Move DC. On a failure, its type is changed to Grass through their next three turns in battle.

Foul Play.description: You turn a creature's own power against it. Make a melee attack roll using your MOVE power. On a hit, the target takes an amount of dark damage equal to + the target's level.
Foul Play.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Freeze Shock.description: When you use this move, you charge up a ball of rock-hard ice. On your next turn's action, if you keep your concentration, you fire your electrically charged ice at a creature. Make a ranged attack roll, dealing ice damage on a hit. On natural attack rolls of 15 or more, the target is paralyzed.
Freeze Shock.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Freeze-Dry.description: You unleash a freezing cold air that rapidly chills a creature in range. Make a ranged attack on a creature, dealing ice damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the target is frozen. This move deals super effective damage to water-type creatures. If the target's secondary type is resistant to ice damage, this move deals standard damage instead.
