Freeze-Dry.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Frenzy Plant.description: You summon a whirlwind of jagged branches and razor sharp leaves that batter all creatures in a 30 foot circle, centered on you. All creature caught in the flurry must make a DEX saving throw against your Move DC, taking grass damage on a failure, and half as much on a success. This move saps you of energy, and may not activate it again until after the end of your next turn.
Frenzy Plant.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Frost Breath.description: You blow a gust of freezing cold air at a creature in range. Make a ranged attack roll, dealing ice damage on a hit. This move scores a critical hit on natural attack rolls of 16 and higher.
Frost Breath.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Frustration.description: You lash out at a creature, venting your frustration at your trainer. Make a melee attack roll against a creature, doing normal damage on a hit. When you make this attack, add an additional bonus to hit and damage equal to the number of levels you are below zero on the Loyalty Chart. This move bypasses the Loyalty penalty roll, except for uncontrollable creatures based on SR limitations.
Frustration.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Fury Attack.description: You reach out and unleash relentless strikes against a creature. Make a melee attack roll, doing normal damage on a hit. After successfully hitting a target, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, you may immediately hit again for an additional normal damage. Continue this process until you fail to roll a 3 or 4 on the d4 roll, up to a maximum of four additional hits.
Fury Attack.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move change to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Fury Cutter.description: You unleash series of cuts against a creature that increase in strength. When you activate this move, make a melee attack on a target in range, doing bug damage on a hit. If you use this move on your turn in consecutive rounds, double the dice roll for damage each time you hit. The multiplier maxes out at 8x the original damage. The damage resets if any of the attacks miss, or if you are incapacitated.
Fury Cutter.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move change to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Fury Swipes.description: You reach out and unleash relentless claw attacks against a creature. Make a melee attack roll, doing normal damage on a hit. After successfully hitting a target, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, you may immediately hit again for an additional normal damage. Continue this process until you fail to roll a 3 or 4 on the d4 roll, up to a maximum of four additional hits.
Fury Swipes.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Fusion Bolt.description: You summon a gigantic lightning bolt that strikes down from the heavens in a 60 foot circle, centered on a point within range. All creatures caught in the blast must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking electric damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. If Fusion Flare was already used this round, double the damage dealt.
Fusion Bolt.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 4d10 at level 5, 6d10 at level 10, and 8d12 at level 17.

Fusion Flare.description: You summon a gigantic fireball that strikes down from the heavens in a 60 foot circle, centered on a point within range. All creatures caught in the blast must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. If Fusion Bolt was already used this round, double the damage dealt. Fusion Flare may be used to thaw out the user from the frozen status before attacking.
Fusion Flare.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 4d10 at level 5, 6d10 at level 10, and 8d12 at level 17.

Future Sight.description: You save an attack to unleash at a later time. When you activate this move, you may choose to attack on this turn, or delay the attack. You may use the attack as a free action at any time during the next three rounds. When you make the attack, make a ranged attack roll, dealing psychic damage on a hit.
Future Sight.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Gastro Acid.description: You hurl stomach acid towards a target. Make a ranged attack. On a hit, the target is covered in the disgusting substance and cannot benefit from the effect of any of its abilities for the duration.

Gear Grind.description: You send a pair of steel gears at a target(s) in range. Make two ranged attacks, dealing steel damage with each hit.
Gear Grind.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Gear Up.description: You engage your gears to raise the attack of ally creatures in range with the Plus or Minus ability. While you maintain your concentration, Pokémon under the affects of Gear Up have advantage on all attack rolls.

Geomancy.description: You spend time to absorb the natural energy around you, sharply increasing your effect in battle. When you activate this move, your speed increases by 10 feet and all of your attacks and saving throws are rolled with advantage for three rounds.

Giga Drain.description: You attempt to drain the life force of a target. Make a ranged attack on a target, doing grass damage on a hit. Half of the damage dealt is restored to the user.
Giga Drain.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Giga Impact.description: You charge at a creature with every ounce of your power. Make a melee attack, dealing normal damage on a hit. This move cannot be used on consecutive turns by the same creature.
Giga Impact.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Glaciate.description: You blow a wind of freezing cold air at a creature in range. Make a ranged attack roll, dealing ice damage on a hit. On a hit, reduce the target's speed by 5 feet. A target reduced to a speed of 0 in this manner becomes frozen. The target may use an action at any time (before becoming frozen) to warm its body, resetting its speed.
Glaciate.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Glare.description: You stare into the depths of a creature's eyes with intense ferocity. The creature must make a WIS saving throw against your Move DC or become frightened for the duration. A creature frightened in this way must make a WIS save against your Move DC at the end of each of its turns to remove the effect.

Grass Knot.description: You attempt to ensnare a creature with vines that sprout from the ground, causing it to trip. Make a ranged attack, dealing grass damage on a hit. If the targets size is Large or bigger, double the dice roll for the damage. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the target falls prone.
Grass Knot.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Grass Pledge.description: You send a column of thick grass towards a creature. Make a ranged attack, dealing grass damage on a hit. After you land a hit, any ally that uses another Pledge move in the same round automatically hits.
Grass Pledge.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Grass Whistle.description: You make a shrill sound that has the chance to put a creature to sleep. The target must make a WIS save against your Move DC, falling asleep on a failure.

Grassy Terrain.description: Grass sprouts from the ground in a circle around you, coating the earth with healing energy. For 3 turns, all creatures in the affected area heal for an amount of hit points equal to their proficiency bonus at the end of their turn. Grounded creatures are those that do not have a flying speed or Levitate, Magnet Rise, or similar ability. In addition, creatures may double their MOVE modifier on damage rolls from grass-type moves activated inside the area.

Gravity.description: You strengthen gravity in an 40 foot circle, centered on you. Any creature in the area cannot use moves like Fly or Bounce, flying types lose their ground immunity, and the Levitate ability is suppressed.

Growl.description: You target a creature with an intimidating growl. The creature must make a WIS save against your Move DC. On a fail, it adds -1 to any attack it makes for the duration. This modifier can be stacked if it fails multiple growl saves, up to a maximum of -5.

Growth.description: You increase the size of a target. When you use this move, a creature in range (or you) grows slightly larger, gaining the ability to add a d4 to any attack roll or saving throw for the duration.
Growth.scaling: Higher Levels: The dice to add increases to 1d6 at level 10.

Grudge.description: When you take damage from a move that reduces you to zero hit points, you may use your reaction to force the attacker to make a WIS saving throw against your Move DC. On a failure, all PP from the move that caused you to faint is depleted .

Guard Split.description: You use your psychic power to change your defense to match the target's the best you can. Force a creature in range to make a CHA save against your Move DC. On a failure, for the duration, your AC changes to become an average of your current AC and the target's, rounded down.

Guard Swap.description: You use your psychic power to swap defenses with a creature. Force a creature in range to make a CHA save against your Move DC. On a failure, switch armor class with the target for the duration.

Guillotine.description: You are filled with an incredible rage, grabbing the head of a target creature in an attempt to squeeze the life from it. Roll a d20. On a 20, you instantly cause the creature to faint. On any other roll, this move has no effect. If the target's level is 10 more than your own, this move automatically fails.

Gunk Shot.description: You fire a wad of icky gunk at a creature. Make a ranged attack, dealing poison damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 16 or higher, the target is poisoned.
Gunk Shot.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Gust.description: You create a strong wind that batters a target in range. Make a ranged attack, doing flying damage on a hit.
Gust.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Gyro Ball.description: You tackle a creature with a high-speed spin. Make a melee attack against a creature, dealing steel damage on a hit. If your DEX score is lower than the target's, double the dice roll for damage.
Gyro Ball.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Hail.description: You stir up a massive hail storm in a 50 foot radius, centered on a point in range. When a non ice-type creature enters the area for the first time on their turn, or begins their turn inside the area, they take an amount of ice damage equal to half your level, rounded up.  The hail storm lasts for 5 rounds.

Hammer Arm.description: You put all your power into a strong and heavy fist attack. Make a melee attack, dealing fighting damage on a hit. Until the beginning of your next turn, you have disadvantage on all DEX saves and your speed is halved.
Hammer Arm.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Happy Hour.description: You celebrate your impending victory with a little jig. Prize money awarded at the end of battle is doubled.

Harden.description: You increase your defense, able to reduce incoming damage. After activating this move, reduce any damage dealt to you by until the beginning of your next turn.
Harden.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d10 at level 10, and 1d12 at level 17.

Haze.description: You create a haze of light snow that washes over creatures in a 60 foot circle, centered on you. Any stat changes, status effects, shields or other outside forces affecting creatures in range are removed. This includes things like Leech Seed, Focus Energy, Substitute, Iron Defense, Disable, etc.

Head Charge.description: You lower your head and charge at a creature. Make a melee attack. On a hit, you deal normal damage, taking a quarter of the total damage (rounded down) in typeless recoil.
Head Charge.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Head Smash.description: You lower your head to deliver a dangerous headbutt. Make a melee attack, dealing rock damage on a hit. On a hit, the user takes 1/2 the damage dealt in typeless recoil.
Head Smash.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Headbutt.description: You really know how to use your head. Make a melee attack roll, doing normal damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 18 or more, the target falls prone.
Headbutt.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Heal Bell.description: You ring a bell that chimes beautifully across the battlefield. All active allied creature in a 120 foot circle, centered on you, are healed of their negative status effects.

Heal Block.description: When a creature within range attempts to use an HP recovery move, item, or ability, you may use your reaction to send psychic waves into the mind of the target, preventing the recovery of health.

Heal Order.description: You summon forth your underlings to heal your wounds. Regain hit points.
Heal Order.scaling: Higher Levels: The healing dice roll for this move changes to 3d6 at level 5, 5d6 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Heal Pulse.description: You emit a healing pulse that restores a target's HP. Choose a target in range (cannot be yourself). The target regains hit points.
Heal Pulse.scaling: Higher Levels: The healing dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Healing Wish.description: You sacrifice yourself for another one of your trainer's Pokémon. When activating this move, the user faints, but the next conscious creature released by its trainer is healed of all status effects and recovers an amount of HP equal to what the user lost by fainting.

Heart Stamp.description: You unleash a vicious blow after acting cute. Make a melee attack against a creature, dealing psychic damage on a hit.
Heart Stamp.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Heart Swap.description: Force a creature in range to make a CHA save against your Move DC. On a failure, you employ your psychic power to swap any changes in ability modifiers, AC, attack changes, damage boosts, etc. that are currently in affect on you or the target.

Heat Crash.description: You slam into a creature with your flaming body. Make a melee attack on a target, dealing a minimum of fire damage on a hit. Add an additional bonus to damage equal to your MOVE modifier for each size level you are above a creature. (Sizes, in order, are: Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, Huge, Gargantuan)
Heat Crash.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Heat Wave.description: You exhale a wave of hot breath in a 30ft. circle, centered on you. Creatures caught in the area must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on failure, or half as much on a success. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is burned.
Heat Wave.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Heavy Slam.description: You slam into a creature with your heavy body. Make a melee attack on a target, dealing a minimum of steel damage on a hit. Add an additional bonus to damage equal to your MOVE modifier for each size level you are above a creature. (Sizes, in order, are: Tiny, Small, Medium, Large, Huge, Gargantuan)
Heavy Slam.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Helping Hand.description: You can use a bonus action on your turn to choose one ally other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear you. That ally can add a d6 to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes within the next 10 minutes, before the result of the roll is called by the DM. An ally being helped can only have one d6 available at a time.
Helping Hand.scaling: Higher Levels: The helping dice for this move changes to d8 at level 5, d10 at level 10, and d12 at level 17.

Hex.description: You send a ghostly energy at a creature that does additional damage to those affected by status conditions. Make a ranged attack, dealing ghost damage on a hit. If the target is affected by a status condition, double your MOVE modifier when adding damage.
Hex.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Hidden Power.description: You unleash a wave of force of unknown power at a creature in range. Make a ranged attack on a creature, doing damage of a random type. Roll a d20 to determine which type of damage is dealt. |d20|Type|d20|Type |:-:|:-:|:-:|:-: |1 |Normal|11 |Psychic |2 |Fire|12 |Bug |3 |Water |13 |Rock |4 |Electric |14 |Ghost |5 |Grass |15 |Dragon |6 |Ice |16 |Dark |7 |Fighting |17 |Steel |8 |Poison |18 |Fairy |9 | Ground |19 |Roll Again |10| Flying|20|Roll Again
Hidden Power.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

High Horsepower.description: You fiercely attack the target using your entire body. Make a melee attack, dealing ground damage on a hit.
High Horsepower.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

High Jump Kick.description: You leap into the air to deliver a strong kick to a target. Make a melee attack, doing fighting damage on a hit. On a miss, you take 1 damage.
High Jump Kick.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Hold Back.description: You lash out with force, but contain your strike to a glancing blow, leaving a creature conscious. Make a melee attack on a target, dealing normal damage on a hit. This attack will always leave its target with 1 hp if it would otherwise cause the target to faint.
Hold Back.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Hold Hands.description: If you are within melee range of an ally, you grasp its hand to spread happiness. Use this reaction when an ally is attacking to add +1 to its attack rolls, or when it is targeted by an attack to add +1 to its AC. This reaction can be used only before the result of either attack roll (by ally or creature) is called.

Hone Claws.description: You sharpen your claws to increase the power of your attacks. For the duration, add an additional +1 to your attack and damage rolls. This move may be stacked to a maximum of +3 to attack and damage rolls.

Horn Attack.description: You strike at a target with your horn. Make a melee attack, doing normal damage on a hit. If you moved 20 feet or more straight towards a target, immediately before activating this move, force a creature to make a STR save against your Move DC or be knocked prone.
Horn Attack.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Horn Drill.description: You attempt to drill your horn through a target creature with tremendous strength. Roll a d20. On a 20, the creature is impaled and immediately faints. On any other roll, you miss and this move fails. If the target's level is 10 more than your own, this move automatically fails.

Horn Leech.description: You sink your horns into a creature, draining some of their power. Make a melee attack, dealing grass damage on a hit. Half the damage dealt is recovered by the user (rounded down).
Horn Leech.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Howl.description: You pierce the air with an intimidating howl. Until the end of your next turn, allies (and you) have advantage on any melee attack rolls they make against a creature within 5 feet of you.

Hurricane.description: You whip up a maelstrom of harsh winds. Each creature in a 30 ft radius, centered on a point within range, must make a STR saving throw against your Move DC, taking flying damage and knocked prone on a failure, or half as much damage without being knocked prone on a success. Targets that fail the saving throw by 5 or more become confused. If this attack is activated during rain, the targets roll their saving throws with disadvantage. If used during harsh sunlight, the targets roll their saves with advantage.
Hurricane.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 6d6 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Hydro Cannon.description: You fire a powerful stream of high-speed water at creatures in a 80 foot line, 5 feet wide. Any creature caught in the blast must make a STR saving throw against your Move DC, taking water damage on a failure, and half as much on a success.. Creatures that fail the save also are pushed back 10 feet and fall prone. This move saps you of energy, and may not activate it again until after the end of your next turn.
Hydro Cannon.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Hydro Pump.description: You send a surge of powerful water towards creatures in a 80 foot line, 5 feet wide. Creatures caught in the blast must succeed on a DEX save against your Move DC, taking water damage on a failed save, and half as much on a success.
Hydro Pump.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 6d6 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Hyper Beam.description: You unleash a concentrated beam of pure energy in a 80 foot line, 5ft wide. Any creature caught in the line must succeed on a DEX save or take normal damage on a fail and half as much on a save. This move cannot be used on consecutive turns by the same creature.
Hyper Beam.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Hyper Fang.description: You lash out at a creature with a quick fang attack. Make a melee attack roll, doing normal damage on a hit. Hyper Fang scores a critical hit on 19 and 20. If the natural attack roll is 18 or more, the target flinches.
Hyper Fang.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Hyper Voice.description: You release a loud and startling, high-pitched sound that only a creature can hear. Make a ranged attack roll against a creature in range, doing normal damage on a hit.
Hyper Voice.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Hyperspace Fury.description: Using your many arms, you send a barrage of three balls of furious energy at any creature(s) in range. Each ball automatically deals 1d6 dark damage to any creature(s) you choose. Reactions that negate damage such as Protect or Detect cannot be used. After activating this move, any attacks against you, until the beginning of your next turn, are rolled at advantage.
Hyperspace Fury.scaling: Higher Levels: You can fire 4 projectiles at level 5, 5 projectiles at level 10, and 6 projectiles at level 17.

Hyperspace Hole.description: You create a hyperspace portal that allows you to instantly teleport to a creature in range and strike out with a melee attack. This move is guaranteed to hit for psychic damage. Reactions that negate damage such as Protect or Detect cannot be used.
Hyperspace Hole.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Hypnosis.description: You attempt to put the target to sleep. The target must make a WIS save against your Move DC, falling asleep on a failure.

Ice Ball.description: You roll into a rock-hard ball of ice and continue to pummel a creature. When you activate this move, make a melee attack on a target in range, doing ice damage on a hit. If you use this move on your turn in consecutive rounds, double the dice roll for damage each time you hit. The multiplier maxes out at 8x the original damage. The damage resets if any of the attacks miss, or if you are incapacitated.
Ice Ball.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d8 at level 5, 1d10 at level 10, and 1d12 at level 17.

Ice Beam.description: You create a 80 foot line of freezing ice, 5 feet wide. Any creature caught in the line must succeed on a DEX save against your Move DC or take ice damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. Creatures that fail this save by 5 or more become frozen.
Ice Beam.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Ice Burn.description: When you use this move, you charge up an intense power within your body. On your next turn's action, if you keep your concentration, you unleash an ultracold, freezing wind in a 60 foot circle all around you. Anyone caught in the blast must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking ice damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. If any creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is burned.
Ice Burn.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 7d6 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Ice Fang.description: You attempt to pierce a creature with ice-infused fangs. Make a melee attack, dealing ice damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the target is frozen and flinches.
Ice Fang.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Ice Hammer.description: You swing and hit with your strong, heavy fist. Make a melee attack dealing ice damage. Until the beginning of your next turn, you have disadvantage on all DEX saves and your speed is halved.
Ice Hammer.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Ice Punch.description: You strike out with ice-infused fists. Make a melee attack roll, doing ice damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, the target is frozen.
Ice Punch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Ice Shard.description: You flash freeze chunks of ice and quickly hurl them at a creature. As a bonus action, you fire a shard of ice at a creature in range. Make a ranged attack roll, dealing ice damage on a hit.
Ice Shard.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d10 at level 10, and 1d12 at level 17.

Icicle Crash.description: You generate a row of icicles that crash down on top of a creature in range. Make a ranged attack, dealing ice damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 15 or higher, the target flinches.
Icicle Crash.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Icicle Spear.description: Your pummel a creature in range with multiple sharp shards of ice. Make a ranged attack roll, doing ice damage on a hit. After successfully hitting a target, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, you may immediately hit again for an additional ice damage. Continue this process until you fail to roll a 3 or 4 on the d4 roll, up to a maximum of four additional hits.
Icicle Spear.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d4 at level 5, 1d12 at level 10, and 4d4 at level 17.

Icy Wind.description: You create an icy wind that gusts towards a creature in range. Make a ranged attack against a creature, doing ice damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 18 or more, the target falls prone.
Icy Wind.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Imprison.description: You create psychic walls within the mind of a target in range. Force the target to make a WIS saving throw against your Move DC. On a failure, the target is unable to use any Move it knows that is the same as yours for the duration.

Incinerate.description: You summon forth a burning hot flame that surrounds a creature. Make a ranged attack, dealing fire damage on a hit. On a hit, if the target is holding a berry, it is immediately burned to ash, becoming unusable.
Incinerate.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Inferno.description: You engulf a target in intense flames. Make a ranged attack against a target, dealing fire damage on a hit, burning the target in the process.
Inferno.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Infestation.description: You summon an infestation of tiny insects to attack a creature for multiple turns. Make a ranged attack on a target. On a hit, the target takes bug damage and becomes infested with swarming bugs. As long as you maintain concentration, the target takes an additional bug damage at the end of each of its next three turns.
Infestation.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Ingrain.description: You pierce the ground with roots, absorbing natural energy and fixing you in place. At the end of each of your next three turns (including this one), heal yourself for hit points. For the duration of this move, your movement speed drops to zero and you may not flee or be switched out by your trainer unless forced by an opponent's moves or abilities.
Ingrain.scaling: Higher Levels: The healing dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Instruct.description: You instruct a creature to act again. As an action, choose a target in range. The target must immediately repeat the move they used in their last action or bonus action, without spending the PP.

Ion Deluge.description: You disperse electric particles that charge the battlefield. Until the beginning of your next turn, any normal-type move activated within 50 feet of you is considered electric-type.

Iron Defense.description: Your body temporarily becomes solid as steel plate. Until the end of your next turn, you gain + 6 to your AC and have resistance to all types of damage. If you were vulnerable, you now take regular damage. If you were already resistant, you become immune.

Iron Head.description: You slam into the target with your hard head. Make a melee attack, dealing steel damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 16 or higher, the target flinches.
Iron Head.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Iron Tail.description: You swing your tail out, attempting to crush a creature. Make an attack roll on a creature in range, doing steel damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is a 19 or 20, the target's AC is decreased by 1 for the rest of combat.
Iron Tail.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Judgment.description: You send powerful missiles of pure energy to rain down on any creature in a 80 foot circle, centered on a point in range. Any creature caught in the area must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. The type of the damage depends on the kind of plate the user is holding.
Judgment.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 4d10 at level 5, 6d10 at level 10, and 8d12 at level 17.

Jump Kick.description: You leap into the air to deliver a strong kick to a creature. Make a melee attack against a target, doing fighting damage on a hit. On a miss, you take 1 damage.
Jump Kick.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Karate Chop.description: You extend a hand towards a target creature for a savage karate chop. Make a melee attack roll, doing fighting damage on a hit. Karate Chop scores a critical hit on 19s and 20s.
Karate Chop.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Kinesis.description: You move with incredible speed. Increase your walking, flying, or swimming speed by 20 if it is greater than 0, and add +2 to AC when targeted by ranged attacks for the duration. This move cannot be stacked.

King\u0027s Shield.description: Your body is cloaked with a protective shield that negates all damage to you. When targeted by an attack, you may automatically avoid taking damage from this attack and any other damaging move until the beginning of your next turn. On future instances of this move in the same combat, you must roll higher than a 15 on a d20 roll for the reaction to be successful.

Knock Off.description: You attempt to rid a creature of their held item for the rest of battle. Make a melee attack roll against a target. On a hit, deal dark damage and any held item of the target disappears. The item appears back in the target's inventory when the battle is over.
Knock Off.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Land\u0027s Wrath.description: You gather in the natural energy of the land around you and focus it into a sudden eruption of earth in a 40 ft radius, centered on a point within range. All creatures caught in the blast must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking ground damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.
Land\u0027s Wrath.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 4d10 at level 5, 6d10 at level 10, and 8d12 at level 17.

Laser Focus.description: When activating this move, you spend your action concentrating intensely. If you keep your concentration, your first atack on your next turn always results in a critical hit.

Last Resort.description: You lash out an a creature with a furious strike. This move can only be activated when all other known moves by a user have been activated in the same combat. If the user is switched out, this rule resets. Make a melee attack, dealing normal damage on a hit.
Last Resort.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 7d6 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Lava Plume.description: You summon forth a plume of raging hot fire in a 5 foot radius, 40-foot cylinder, centered on a point within range. Creatures in the blast must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a failure and becoming burned, or half as much without becoming burned on a success.
Lava Plume.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Leaf Blade.description: You attempt to slash a creature with a sharp leaf. Make a melee attack against a target, dealing grass damage on a hit. This attack scores a critical on 19 and 20.
Leaf Blade.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Leaf Storm.description: You whip up a powerful storm of leaves in a 40 foot circle, centered on a point within range. All creatures in the area must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking grass damage on a fail, or half as much on a success. After activating this move, you are sapped of energy. On any damaging move you activate before the end of your next turn, reduce the damage dealt by your MOVE modifier.
Leaf Storm.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 5d8 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Leaf Tornado.description: You summon forth a cyclone of harsh winds and fast moving leaves that rushes forward to strike a creature in range. Make a ranged attack roll, dealing grass damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 15 or higher, the target has disadvantage on its next attack. If the target activates a move that requires a saving throw, its target(s) have advantage on the roll.
Leaf Tornado.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Leafage.description: You summon a flurry of leaves to pelt a target. Make a ranged attack, doing grass damage on a hit.
Leafage.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Leech Life.description: You attempt to suck away some of a creature's life force. Make a melee attack roll, doing bug damage on a hit. Half of the damage done is restored to the user.
Leech Life.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Leech Seed.description: You send a seed at a creature in range that implants itself in their hide. Make a ranged attack roll. On a hit, a seed implants into their skin. The target takes grass damage at the end of each of its subsequent turns until it faints or is switched out. Half of the damage is restored by the attacker, or any other active creature the trainer has in battle, even if the original attacker faints or is returned to its Pokéball. Only one creature can be seeded by the attacker at a time. Grass-type creatures are immune to the damage from this move.
Leech Seed.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d4 at level 5, 2d6 at level 10, and 2d8 at level 17.

Leer.description: You stare down a target, reducing its will. The creature must make a WIS save against your Move DC. On a fail, allies may add +1 to any attack they target it with for the duration. This modifier can be stacked if it fails multiple leer saves, up to a maximum of +5.

Lick.description: You reach out and lick a target. Make a melee attack roll. On a hit, do ghost damage. On a natural attack roll of 18 or higher, the target becomes paralyzed.
Lick.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Light of Ruin.description: You draw forth a powerful natural essence, concentrating it into a beam of light 80ft long and 5 feet wide. Any creature caught in the blast must make DEX saving throw against your Move DC, taking fairy damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. The user takes typeless recoil damage equal to half the damage roll.
Light of Ruin.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 7d6 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Light Screen.description: When you are subject to a ranged attack, use your reaction to take half the damage dealt now and on any ranged attack that targets you until the beginning of your next turn.

Liquidation.description: You attempt to slam a full-force blast of water into a target in range. Make a ranged attack, doing water damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 18 or more, the target's AC is reduced by 1 while it remains in battle. This decrease may be stacked up to a maximum of -5 to AC.
Liquidation.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Lock-On.description: You hone in on your target, ready to strike. When this move is activated, a single attack roll you make next turn is guaranteed to hit. You may roll to see if you crit or cause an effect from a high roll. This move does not affect one-shot moves like Fissure, Guillotine, etc.

Lovely Kiss.description: You blow a kiss to a creature, attempting to put the target to sleep. The target must make a CHA save against your Move DC, falling asleep on a failure.

Low Kick.description: You kick out at a creature's lower half, dealing damage and attempting to knock it off balance. Make a melee attack, doing fighting damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 19 or 20, the target flinches.
Low Kick.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Low Sweep.description: You sweep your legs at the lower half of a creature's body. Make a melee attack roll, dealing fighting damage on a hit. On a hit, target must succeed on a STR save against your Move DC or be knocked prone.
Low Sweep.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Lucky Chant.description: When a creature scores a critical hit on you or an ally in range, you may use your reaction to quickly recite a magical incantation that treats the attack like a normal hit, preventing the extra damage and/or effect of the crit.

Lunar Dance.description: You sacrifice yourself for another one of your trainer's Pokémon. When activating this move, the user faints, but the next creature released by its trainer is fully healed and cured of any status effects.

Lunge.description: You make a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. Make a melee attack, doing bug damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 15 or more, the target has disadvantage on its next attack.
Lunge.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Luster Purge.description: You create a blinding bright light that damages creature's eyes and may lower their defense. Creatures in range must make a CON save against your Move DC, taking psychic damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. For creatures that fail by 5 or more, any attack against them has advantage until the end of your next turn.
Luster Purge.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 6d6 at level 5, 8d6 at level 10, and 7d12 at level 17.

Mach Punch.description: You rush forward to punch with incredible speed. Choose a target within 10 feet of you. You rush forward to slam a fist into the creature, avoiding all attacks of opportunity. Make a melee attack on that creature, dealing fighting damage on a hit.
Mach Punch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d10 at level 10, and 1d12 at level 17.

Magic Coat.description: A flash of magical energy forms between you and a creature, reflecting negative energy back at an attacker in range. When an attack from a creature causes you to suffer from a negative status condition, they are also affected by the same condition.

Magic Room.description: You employ your psychic power to suppress the effect of all held items in a 100 foot circle, centered on you.

Magical Leaf.description: You summon a sharp, magical leaf that strikes a creature. This move is guaranteed to hit for grass damage, unless during the invulnerable stage of Fly, Dig, Bounce, Dive, etc. moves.
Magical Leaf.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Magma Storm.description: You stir up a maelstrom of fire in a 40 foot circle, centered on a point within range, that continues to rage as long as you hold your concentration. Any creature that enters this area for the first time on their turn, or is in that area at the beginning of their turn must make a CON save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.
Magma Storm.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Magnet Bomb.description: You hurl a steel ball that seeks out a creature in range, never missing. This move is guaranteed to hit for steel damage, unless during the invulnerable stage of Fly, Dig, Bounce, Dive, etc. moves.
Magnet Bomb.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Magnet Rise.description: You use magnetic power within yourself to raise yourself from the ground, becoming immune to ground moves for the duration.

Magnetic Flux.description: You use your electric energy to manipulate magnetic fields. Until the beginning of your next turn, any creature in range with the Plus or Minus ability gains a bonus to their AC equal to your proficiency modifier, and any saving throw they are forced to make is rolled with advantage.

Magnitude.description:
You shake the ground with an earth-shattering quake. All creature in range must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking half damage on a success and full damage on a fail. Creatures in range that are burrowed or in the invulnerable stage of Dig take double damage from this move. Roll a d100 on the table below to determine damage. Raised creatures are immune to the effects and damage of this move.
- 
| d100  | Damage |
|:---:|:-----------:|
|  01-05  | 1d4+MOVE |
|  06-15  | 1d8+MOVE |
|  16-35  | 1d10+MOVE |
|  36-65  | 1d12+MOVE |
|  66-85  | 2d6+MOVE |
|  86-95  | 2d8+MOVE |
|  96-100  | 2d12+MOVE |
Magnitude.scaling: Higher Levels: For damage rolls, use 2x Dice at level 5, 3x Dice at level 10, and 4x Dice at level 17.

Mat Block.description: You conjure up a ethereal, protective mat to shield you and your allies. Until the end of your next turn, any ally creature within 15 feet of you (including you) is immune to damage from damaging moves. Status-inducing moves can still affect their targets.

Me First.description: When targeted by or forced to make a saving throw from a single-target move, you may use your reaction to copy the creature's move against it, after activation but before the effects. If the move requires an attack roll, you have disadvantage on the attack. If the move requires a saving throw, the target has advantage on the roll. If the move causes damage, double the damage dice. The damage/effect tier for the move is based off of your level, not the target's.

Mean Look.description: You flash an intimidating look at a target, attempting to freeze them in fear. Force a target in range to make a WIS save against your Move DC. On a fail, the target cannot flee or be switched out for 3 rounds.

Meditate.description: You become one with your inner self. For the duration, you gain +1 to attack rolls and saving throws.
Meditate.scaling: Higher Levels: The bonus changes to +2 at level 5, +3 at level 10, and +4 at level 17.

Mega Drain.description: You attempt to drain the life force of a target. Make a ranged attack on a target, doing grass damage on a hit. Half of the damage dealt is restored to the user.
Mega Drain.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Mega Kick.description: You strike out with a hard kick. Make a melee attack against a target, doing normal damage on a hit.
Mega Kick.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Mega Punch.description: You strike out with a hard punch Make a melee attack against a target, doing normal damage on a hit.
Mega Punch.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Megahorn.description: You charge at a creature for a devastating horn attack. Make a melee attack roll, doing bug damage on a hit. If you moved 20 feet or more straight towards a target, immediately before activating this move, force a creature to make a STR save against your Move DC or be knocked prone.
Megahorn.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Memento.description: You sacrifice your life force to leave a lasting mark on a target. When you activate this move, you touch a creature and drop to 0 hit points. As a result, the target is incapacitated for 2 rounds. All attacks against it have advantage, it automatically fails all STR and DEX saving throws by the maximum amount, and it cannot attack, move, flee, or be switched out.

Metal Burst.description: You lash out in retaliation with a bust of harsh metal shards. As a reaction, when you are hit with a melee attack that deals damage, make a melee attack roll against your attacker, with disadvantage. On a hit, deal the same amount of steel type damage back at your attacker (maximum of 5x your current level).

Metal Claw.description: You strike out with sharp claws. Make a melee attack roll against a creature, doing steel damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 19 or 20, your next attack gets an additional +1 to hit.
Metal Claw.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Metal Sound.description: You emit an ear-shattering high pitched sound that only your target can hear, leaving them in a defenseless state. When activating this move, a target must make a CON saving throw against your Move DC. On a failure, all attack rolls against the target are given a +5 bonus until the end of your next turn.

Meteor Mash.description: You smash a creature with a fist as fast as a meteor strike. Make a melee attack against a creature, doing steel damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 18 or higher, your next attack has advantage.
Meteor Mash.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Metronome.description: You summon a move at random to inflict against a creature. When you use this move, roll a d100. The resulting number is the TM number for the move you make. If the move is unable to be completed because of positioning, range, etc., Metronome fails.

Milk Drink.description: You create a tasty drink that heals your or an ally's wounds. The recipient gains hit points.
Milk Drink.scaling: Higher Levels: The dice roll for this move changes to 3d6 at level 5, 5d6 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Mimic.description: You copy another creature's movements, learning its ways in battle. When used, this move is temporarily replaced by your choice of one of the target's moves. The target can be an ally. After one PP is subtracted to use this move, the replacement move will retain Mimic's remaining PP. The user can select any of the target's moves to copy for the duration.

Mind Blown.description: You fill your head with hot fire that explodes around you. Force all creaatures within 15 feet of you to make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. After activating this move, you take an amount of typless damage equal to the full damage as if you failed the save.
Mind Blown.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 6d8 at level 10, and 6d12 at level 17.

Mind Reader.description: You sense the motives and moves of a creature around you. When this move is activated, a single attack roll you make next turn is guaranteed to hit. You may roll to see if you crit or cause an effect from a high roll. This move does not affect one-shot moves like Fissure, Guillotine, etc.

Minimize.description: You appear smaller to your creatures, increasing your evasion. For the duration, you gain an additional +2 to your AC.

Miracle Eye.description: You flash your eyes at the target, stunning them briefly and lowering their defenses. When activating this move, choose a target in range and force them to make a WIS save against your Move DC. On a failure, any modifiers to their AC are reset, and if they are Dark or Ghost-type, their immunities are relinquished for the duration. If, when losing immunity, the target's secondary type gives it vulnerability or resistance to an attack of that type, it follows the secondary type for that effect.

Mirror Coat.description: When subject to a ranged attack, you can attempt to decrease the damage and send some back at the attacker in range. Using this reaction, the damage is decreased by . If this causes the damage to fall below zero, the attack is deflected and you may make a ranged attack roll to send it back at the attacker for psychic damage.
Mirror Coat.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Mirror Move.description: You mimic a target that you can see, in range. When you activate this move, choose a target in range and fully execute the most recent move used by the creature, using your own ability scores, level, and typing for saving throw DC, attack, and damage.

Mirror Shot.description: You loose a damaging flash of light from your polished body. Make a ranged attack on a creature, dealing steel damage on a hit. On a hit, the target must make a CON save against your Move DC. On a failure, the target has disadvantage on its next attack roll.
Mirror Shot.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Mist Ball.description: You fire an explosive ball of damaging mist at a creature in range. Make a ranged attack against a target, doing psychic damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is higher than 10, the target has disadvantage on any attack it makes before the end of its next turn..
Mist Ball.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 4d10 at level 5, 6d10 at level 10, and 8d12 at level 17.

Mist.description: A light mist surrounds a target, offering a protective barrier. The target is immune to negative stat changes for the duration, but any current effects are still in place.

Misty Terrain.description: You cover the ground in a thin, healing mist that surrounds a 120 foot circle, centered on you. For 3 turns, no grounded creatures inside the mist can suffer from new status conditions. Grounded creatures are those that do not have a flying speed or Levitate, Magnet Rise, or similar ability.

Moonblast.description: You summon forth a powerful moonbeam that strikes a creature. Make a ranged attack on a target in range, dealing fairy damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 15 or more, the target has disadvantage on its next attack.
Moonblast.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Moongeist Beam.description: You emit a sinister ray that explodes out from you in a 100 foot line, 5 feet wide. All creatures caught in the blast must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking ghost damage on a failure or half as much on a success. This attack ignores any of the creatures abilities that would affect the user's ability to hit or deal full damage.
Moongeist Beam.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 4d10 at level 5, 6d10 at level 10, and 8d12 at level 17.

Moonlight.description: A ray of moonlight shines upon you, basking you in healing light. The user gains hit points. If this move is activated during the day, halve the total healing.
Moonlight.scaling: Higher Levels: The dice roll for healing changes to 3d10 at level 5, 7d6 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Morning Sun.description: A ray of sunlight shines upon you, basking you in healing light. The user gains hit points. If this move is activated at night, halve the total healing.
Morning Sun.scaling: Higher Levels: The healing dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 7d6 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Mud Bomb.description: You throw a hard-packed mud ball at a creature. Make a ranged attack, dealing ground damage on a hit. On a hit, the target must make a CON save against your Move DC. On a failure, the target has disadvantage on its next attack roll. If activating a move that requires a save, the target(s) have advantage.
Mud Bomb.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Mud Shot.description: You fire a glob of mud at a creature, dealing damage with a chance to hinder the target's movement. Make a ranged attack against a creature in range, dealing ground damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is higher than 15, the target's speed becomes 0 until the end of its next turn.
Mud Shot.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Mud Sport.description: You cover yourself and all allies around you with thick mud, reducing the amount of electric damage taken for anyone affected. For the duration, you and any ally in range (when you initially activated this move) have resistance to electric-type attacks. If you were already resistant, you are now immune. If you were vulnerable, you now take regular damage. If you are immune to electric-type moves already, nothing happens.

Mud-Slap.description: You hurl mud at a target in range. Make a ranged attack roll, doing ground damage on a hit. On a hit, the target adds -1 to its attack rolls for the rest of the encounter. This decrease may be stacked, up to a maximum of -5 to hit. The target may take an action to remove any mud from its face, resetting the effect.
Mud-Slap.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d4 at level 5, 1d12 at level 10, and 4d4 at level 17.

Muddy Water.description: You fire a stream of muddy water at a creature in range. Make a ranged attack against a creature, dealing water damage. If the natural attack roll is 15 or higher, the target has disadvantage on its next attack.
Muddy Water.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Multi-Attack.description: You strike out with inner power, depending on your type. Make a melee attack on a target, dealing damage of your current type.
Multi-Attack.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Mystical Fire.description: You summon forth a pair of mystical flames that dance around a target, dealing damage. Make a ranged attack roll against a target, dealing fire damage on a hit. If the target is hit with this attack, any attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn is rolled at disadvantage.
Mystical Fire.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Nasty Plot.description: You stimulate your brain with nasty thoughts. For the duration, you have advantage on any attacks with the Wisdom, Intelligence, or Charisma move power. If the attack requires a Wisdom, Intelligence, or Charisma saving throw, the target has disadvantage.

Natural Gift.description:
You draw in power from your held berry, releasing it into a ranged attack. Make a ranged attack, dealing damage on a hit. The type is dependant on what berry you are holding, according to the chart below:
| Type | Berry| |:---:|:-----------:| | Normal | Chilan | | Fire | Cherri, Occa | | Water | Chesto, Passho | | Electric | Pecha, Waccan | | Grass | Rawst, Rindo | | Ice | Aspear, Yache | | Fighting | Leppa, Chople | | Poison | Oran, Kebia | | Ground | Persim, Shucca | | Type | Berry | |:---:|:-----------:| | Flying | Lum, Coba | | Psychic | Sitrus, Payapa | | Bug | Tanga | | Rock | Charti | | Ghost | Kasib | | Dragon | Haban | | Dark | Colbur | | Steel | Babiri, Razz | | Fairy | Roseli |
Natural Gift.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Nature Power.description:
You call upon the powers of nature nearby and activate a move based on the terrain. The DM gets final say on what move you activate, but here are example terrain types:

| Terrain  | Move |
|:---:|:-----------:|
|  Cities/Roads/Buildings  | Swift |
|  Sandy areas  | Earthquake |
|  Volcanoes/Lava areas  | Fire Blast |
|  Caves, Dark areas  | Shadow Ball |
|  Rocky terrain, Mountains  | Rock Slide |
|  Fields, Plains  | Stun Spore |
|  Forests, Tall Grasslands  | Razor Leaf |
|  Ponds/Swamps  | Bubble Beam |
|  At sea | Surf |
|  Underwater | Hydro Pump |
|  Snowy | Blizzard |

Nature\u0027s Madness.description: You harness all the power of nature and send it at a creature in range. The target must make a CON save against your Move DC. On a failed save, the target loses half their current HP (minimum of 1 damage).

Needle Arm.description: Your arms turn to jagged, thorny needles as you strike a creature. Make a melee attack on a creature, dealing grass damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is a 15 or more, the target flinches.
Needle Arm.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Night Daze.description: A pitch black shockwave of dark energy rushes towards a target. Make a ranged attack roll, dealing dark damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 13 or more, the target rolls its next attack with disadvantage. If it activates a move that requires a saving throw, the target(s) have advantage on the roll.
Night Daze.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Night Shade.description: You hit a target with a necrotic wave of dark energy. Make a ranged attack against a target. On a hit, the ghost damage is equal to + the user's level.
Night Shade.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d4+Level at level 5, 1d12+Level at level 10, and 4d4+Level at level 17.

Night Slash.description: You slash out at a creature with dark power. Make a melee attack, dealing dark damage on a hit. This attack scores a critical hit on natural attack rolls of 19 or 20.
Night Slash.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 2d12 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Nightmare.description: You create a horrible nightmare in the mind of any sleeping creature in a 120 foot circle around you, inflicting ghost damage automatically. This move does not wake a sleeping creature.
Nightmare.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 4d6 at level 5, 5d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Noble Roar.description: You let out a stunning roar that intimidates a target. When targeted by an attack, use this reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

Nuzzle.description: You touch a creature with your electrified cheeks, sending electricity coursing through their veins. Make an attack roll against a creature. On a hit, the target takes electric damage and is forced to make a CON save against your Move DC, becoming paralyzed on a failure.
Nuzzle.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d4 at level 5, 1d12 at level 10, and 4d4 at level 17.

Oblivion Wing.description: You extend your wings and use a dark beam of energy to absorb the target's life force. Make a ranged attack against a creature, dealing flying damage on a hit, recovering your own hit points by the amount of damage dealt.
Oblivion Wing.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 5d6 at level 5, 4d12 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Octazooka.description: You send a blast of ink towards your creatures. Make a ranged attack roll, doing water damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 18 or more, the target must add -1 to attack rolls for the remainder of this combat.
Octazooka.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Odor Sleuth.description: When you activate this move, choose a target in range. For the duration, the target cannot activate any move that would increase its AC. If it has already activated such a move, the effect ends immediately. In addition, for the duration, no creature in range has immunity to your Ghost, Normal, or Fighting-type moves.

Ominous Wind.description: You stir up a gust of repulsive wind that strikes a creature in range. Make a ranged attack, dealing ghost damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 19 or 20, increase all of your ability scores by +1 while you remain in battle.
Ominous Wind.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Origin Pulse.description: Your body glows a bright and brilliant blue, sending three beams of focused light at any creature(s) in range. Make a ranged attack for each beam, dealing water damage on each successful hit.
Origin Pulse.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Outrage.description: You go into a rampage, doing several attacks without control for three rounds. This move automatically hits for dragon damage in the first round, dragon damage in the second round, and dragon damage in the third round. When this move ends, either after the third round or from breaking concentration, you become confused. This attack stops if concentration is broken, or the user becomes incapacitated.
Outrage.scaling: Higher Levels: The dice used for this move changes to a d8 at level 5, a d10 at level 10, and a d12 at level 17.

Overheat.description: With a roar, flames burst from your body in a 30 foot circle, centered on you. Any creature in range must roll a DEX saving throw against your Move DC, taking fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. The power of the move exhausts you, and your next attack is done at disadvantage. If your next attack requires a creature saving throw, they have advantage.
Overheat.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d10 at level 5, 5d8 at level 10, and 8d8 at level 17.

Pain Split.description: You split pain from your injuries with your attacker. Target a creature in range, forcing them to make a CON save against your Move DC. On a fail, both you and your attacker change your current health points to the average of the two. If this causes either creature to go above maximum health, they take their maximum health instead.

Parabolic Charge.description: A sweeping electric charge arcs around you, stealing some of the target's energy. Force all creatures in a 60 foot circle, centered on you, to make a CON save against your Move DC, taking electric damage on a failure. Recover hit points equal to half the total damage dealt, but no more than 5 times your level.
Parabolic Charge.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Parting Shot.description: You deliver a brutal parting threat just before switching out. Force a creature in range to make a WIS save against your Move DC, then switch out immediately. On a failure, the target deals half damage on their next turn if using a damaging move.

Pay Day.description: You strike a target, causing it to shake out its purse. Make a melee attack, doing normal damage on a hit. In addition, 10x the user's level in cash is scattered on the floor until the end of combat. This release of funds can only occur once per target per combat.
Pay Day.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Payback.description: You strike hard in retaliation. Make a melee attack, dealing dark damage on a hit. If the target damaged you on the turn immediately before yours, double the dice roll for the damage of this attack.
Payback.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Peck.description: You hammer down on a target with a peck attack. Make a melee attack roll on a target, doing flying damage on a successful hit.
Peck.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d10 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 5d4 at level 17.

Perish Song.description: You perform a song with devastating consequences to creatures that hear it. All creatures in range (including you) must make a CON saving throw against your Move DC. For any that fail, they faint in 3 rounds, on their turn, unless fleeing or switched out by their trainer before the end of the three rounds.

Petal Blizzard.description: You stir up a blizzard of sharp petals that swirl around you. Any creature in a 60 foot circle, centered on you, must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking grass damage on a failure, or half as much on a success.
Petal Blizzard.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Petal Dance.description: You dance around, releasing a flurry of sharp leaf attacks against a creature in range. Make a ranged attack roll, dealing grass damage on a hit. On the following turn, you may choose to use this action again to hit automatically, but if you do, you become confused at the end of your turn.
Petal Dance.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move change to 2d6 at level 5, 3d6 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Phantom Force.description: You disappear from view and prepare to surprise your target with an attack. When you activate this move, you become invisible and immune to any attacks of opportunity. You cannot be targeted by attacks while you are invisible. On your next turn, you use your action to reappear and make a melee attack against a creature, with advantage, dealing ghost damage on a successful hit. Protect and Detect reactions may not be used when hit by this attack.
Phantom Force.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Photon Geyser.description: A pillar of light erupts from the ground in a 20ft radius, 80ft high cylinder centered on a point in range. Any creature caught in the blast must make a DEX save against your Move DC, taking psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. This move ignores any of the creatures abilities that would affect the user's ability to hit or deal full damage.
Photon Geyser.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 4d10 at level 5, 6d10 at level 10, and 8d12 at level 17.

Pin Missile.description: You strike a creature with sharp projectiles in quick succession. Make a ranged attack roll, doing bug damage on a hit. After successfully hitting a target, roll a d4. On a result of 3 or 4, another projectile hits again for an additional bug damage. Continue this process until you fail to roll a 3 or 4 on the d4 roll, up to a maximum of four additional hits.
Pin Missile.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice rolls for this move change to 2d4 at level 5, 1d12 at level 10, and 4d4 at level 17.

Plasma Fists.description: You charge up your firsts with electricity and lash out at a target. Make a melee attack, dealing electric damage on a hit. On a hit, both you and your target's normal-type moves become electric-type until the end of your next turn.
Plasma Fists.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d12 at level 5, 4d8 at level 10, and 8d6 at level 17.

Play Nice.description: You convince a creature that you mean it no harm. Force a creature to make a CHA saving throw against your Move DC. On a failure, any attack the target makes on its next turn is rolled at disadvantage. If the target activates a move that requires a saving throw, you have advantage on the roll.

Play Rough.description: You fake a creature out with a playful attack that quickly becomes too rough. Make a melee attack against a creature, dealing fairy damage on a hit. On natural attack rolls of 19 or 20, the target adds -1 to any attack it makes for the remainder of combat. This effect can be stacked to a maximum of -5 to hit.
Play Rough.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Pluck.description: You peck at a target, attempting to grab their held berry. Make a melee attack on a creature, dealing flying damage on a hit. On a hit, if the target is holding a berry, you swallow it immediately and gain its effect.
Pluck.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 5d4 at level 10, and 4d8 at level 17.

Poison Fang.description: You lash forward with poisonous venom. Make a melee attack roll against a creature, dealing poison damage on a hit, forcing the target to make a CON save against your Move DC. On a failure, the creature is poisoned. A creature poisoned by this move takes double the normal poison damage at the end of each of its turns.
Poison Fang.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Poison Gas.description: You create a fog of poisonous gas in a 15 foot radius, centered on a point within range. Creatures that begin their turn in the area take poison damage and must succeed on a CON save against your Move DC or become poisoned. The gas cloud dissipates at the beginning of your next turn.
Poison Gas.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Poison Jab.description: You stab a creature with an appendage steeped in poison. Make a melee attack on a creature, dealing poison damage on a hit. On a natural attack roll of 16 or higher, the target is poisoned.
Poison Jab.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Poison Powder.description: You release a cluster of poisonous spores that burst into the air above a target. The creature must succeed on a CON save against your Move DC, becoming poisoned on a fail.

Poison Sting.description: You strike out at a creature with a poisonous sting. Make a melee attack roll against a target, doing poison damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 18 or more, the creature is poisoned.
Poison Sting.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 2d6 at level 17.

Poison Tail.description: Poisonous barbs sprout from your tail as you swing it at a creature. Make a melee attack against a creature, dealing poison damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is a 19 or 20, the move scores a critical hit and the target is poisoned.
Poison Tail.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d6 at level 5, 4d4 at level 10, and 3d10 at level 17.

Pollen Puff.description: You send forth a flurry of pollen at a target in range. Make a ranged attack roll, dealing bug damage on a hit. If the target is an ally, this move automatically hits and heals for the amount of damage instead.
Pollen Puff.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Pound.description: You crush a creature with a pound attack. Make a melee attack roll against a target, doing normal damage on a hit.
Pound.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Powder Snow.description: You send a blast of cold snow at a creature. Make a ranged attack roll on a creature, doing ice damage on a hit. If the natural attack roll is 18 or higher, the target is frozen.
Powder Snow.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d12 at level 5, 2d8 at level 10, and 4d6 at level 17.

Powder.description: You quickly coat a creature in an explosive powder. When a creature in range activates a fire-type move, you may use your reaction to release a spray of flammable powder that explodes and automatically deals typeless damage to the target.
Powder.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d10 at level 5, 3d10 at level 10, and 4d12 at level 17.

Power Gem.description: A ray of light bursts out of your gemstone, damaging a creature in range. Make a ranged attack, dealing rock damage on a hit.
Power Gem.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 2d8 at level 5, 4d6 at level 10, and 6d6 at level 17.

Power Split.description: You use your psychic power to change your offense to match the target's the best you can. Force a creature in range to make a CHA save against your Move DC. On a failure, choose either your STR, DEX, or WIS. For the duration, replace the chosen ability score with the average of your current score and the target's score.

Power Swap.description: As a bonus action, force a creature in range to make a WIS save against your Move DC. On a failure, you employ your psychic power to swap a single ability score with a creature until the end of their next turn, for purposes of attack and damage rolls.

Power Trick.description: You employ your psychic power to switch your own attack and defense. Until the end of your next turn, switch your AC with an ability score of your choice (Constitution not included)

Power Trip.description: You boast your strength and attack a target. Make a melee attack, doing dark damage on a hit. For each unique stat change affecting the user, add an additional damage dice.
Power Trip.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 1d6 at level 5, 1d8 at level 10, and 1d10 at level 17.

Power Whip.description: You violently whirl your tentacles or vines towards a target. Make a melee attack against a creature, dealing grass damage on a hit
Power Whip.scaling: Higher Levels: The damage dice roll for this move changes to 3d8 at level 5, 4d10 at level 10, and 7d8 at level 17.

Power-Up Punch.description: You strike out with a powerful punch that increases in strength the more you hit. Make a melee attack on a target, dealing fighting damage on a successful hit against the same creature. For each successful hit, add an additional damage dice, with a maximum number of damage dice equal to double the original amount. The damage resets if you miss or target a different creature.
